item.title: Translate
item.description: This example translates the text “current_directory” to the current directory. { } rule translate = parse | "current_directory" { print_string (Sys.getcwd ()) } | _ as c { print_char c } | eof { exit 0 } { let main () = let lexbuf = Lexing.from_channel stdin in while true do translate lexbuf done let _ = Printexc.print main () }

item.title: Word count
item.description: This example shows the number of lines, words and characters of the given file if the filename is given, or of the standard input if no command arguments are given. { } rule count lines words chars = parse | '\n' { count (lines+1) words (chars+1) lexbuf } | [^ ' ' '\t' '\n']+ as word { count lines (words+1) (chars+ String.length word) lexbuf } | _ { count lines words (chars+1) lexbuf } | eof { (lines, words, chars) } { let main () = let cin = if Array.

item.title: Toy language
item.description: In this example, the scanner function toy_lang returns a value of token type, but the main function does nothing with it. { open Printf let create_hashtable size init = let tbl = Hashtbl.create size in List.iter (fun (key, data) -> Hashtbl.add tbl key data) init; tbl type token = | IF | THEN | ELSE | BEGIN | END | FUNCTION | ID of string | OP of char | INT of int | FLOAT of float | CHAR of char let keyword_table = create_hashtable 8 [ ("if", IF); ("then", THEN); ("else", ELSE); ("begin", BEGIN); ("end", END); ("function", FUNCTION) ] } let digit = ['0'-'9'] let id = ['a'-'z' 'A'-'Z']['a'-'z' '0'-'9']* rule toy_lang = parse | digit+ as inum { let num = int_of_string inum in printf "integer: %s (%d)\n" inum num; INT num } | digit+ '.
